fields.title: Harris 1982 Housing and Home Ownership Survey, study no. 817020

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue:
This survey focuses on the housing market and recent purchase of a residence

"Additional questions included reasons for buying; selling potential; reason for possible move; major source of funds; expected down payment; expected mortgage rate; type of mortgage; options for financing a residence; and level of understanding of mortgage options"

fields.notesText:
Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Harris telephone surveys use a form of random digit dialing. From a random multi-stage cluster sampling design, they obtain a national cross-section of U.S. adults. Interviewers are usually given the first five digits of a series of randomly selected residential telephone numbers that have pr
eviously been stratified by geographic locations, including minor civil divisions. The interviewer then adds two randomly generated digits to complete a new seven-digit number; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-8170-20;
